TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 343
TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F. Austin to William Eads, 04-11-1819

barker_notes.barker_footnotes: Original in possession of Mrs. Emmett L. Perry
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 343

div1.p: Recd of William Eads 1 double Barrel of Whiskey Sixty seven Gallons and Six Barrels of Flour belonging to James Bryan which I take to Red River also six and half whisky Barrels of Beef five whisky Barrels of Pork and three small Barrels of Pork—for R. River there was 1 barrel and 40 pounds of flour and half a barrel of Pork Stole by Steward also delivered Madame Minci three Barrels of Flour to replace that much flour used by Minci for the Biscuit also recd of Madame Minci ten Barrels of Biscuit
